values:
SO I need to get a few things off my chest...

First off, I'd like to give a huge high five to most of my girlfriends that have dumped their shitty ass boyfriends to better themselves or to be that special other.  These girls know who they are and really deserve a big pat on the back for ....well, first, putting up with their asshole boyfriends, and second, being able to finally kick them to the curb!
Anyways, bravo for standing up for yourselves and getting the man that you deserve!

Second of all....I found out that my loser ex-boyfriend found himself a new female.  I was very excited to find this out.  However, I've come to find out that she's 15 years old......and he's 23.

I had a really long talk with him before this about finding himself a classy woman that is around his age.  But, then I came to realize that no living female above the age of 20 would want to put up with a person like him.  The boy has no goals in life and basically hasn't put any forward movement into life.  He has a band consisting of all 15-17 year old kids that are his cult that follow him around.
Anyways, point being....I'm half way tempted to blow up on his stupid ass to help him realize what he is getting himself into......But then I started to wonder if I actually cared if he gets arrested and put on the sex offender's list....or if it was just me wanting to prove someone ignorant and wrong.  I've come to the point of not caring...but, I am slightly offended.
See, we had a very long conversation about women and how to be able to find one without going to bars or clubs.  I was basically shooting in the dark with effort, but it seemed to get through to him rather well.  He thanked me every way and told me that it inspired him.  Needless to say, I was shooting in the dark and it got nowhere but into a little girl's pants.

So, my life feels a little more crushed knowing that my efforts were for not.  But, my life is brighter with the knowledge that my ex could end up on the Illinois Sex Offender List!

So, keep your eyes open kids!  Who knows....the next sexual predator could be your local Subway sandwich maker!  :P

Snow Snow Snow Snow!!  Talk about crazy insane!

Thursday was unbelievable.  I was watching to storm the entire time because my boyfriend wanted to come and visit.  It is about a 3 hour drive from the St. Louis area.  It took him about 6.  I was scared the entire time and fighting back tears.  Scared shitless....but, he made it here alive and shaken from it.  I about burst into tears....but, I did pretty good at holding it back.

Friday came with the announcement of a snow day.  I was pretty excited by it, however I had a presentation to do that day and a test.  I was completely ready for the presentation, but screw the test!  Anyways, the day was lazy and eventful except for trying to get Abby's car out of the snow.  Which didn't happen.  We had to call a tow truck.  Then Dylan left at 6:00 am to get to work on time.  I felt so bad.

Saturday (last night) was so nuts.  Maddy, James, Derek and I ended up at the Pace at 10:45 at night.  The boys got carded twice at the bar which was basically crawling with cops.  It got to 2:00 am and we had to leave.  So, we go outside to find even more cops.  I ended up seeing what I thought was a cat fight....but, ended up being a cop wrestling a drunk (probably underage) girl to the ground.  I guess she was cooperating very well and the maced the chick.  Then, another girl was slammed against a cop car getting arrested also.  NUTS!

I am here procrastinating and eating sushi.  Which was also an adventure trying to park and getting stuck in the snow.....ugh.  Never again.  Anyways, I'm lazy an watching animal planet.  Sorry for the randomness!!

So, I got home from work today and layed down to take a nap.  I feel asleep for a few minutes, but I had a dream that I woke up and I was at Dylan's place.  I looked over and saw him still sleeping next to me.  So, I cuddle up next to him and he felt very very cold.  I then woke up and realized that I was cuddling with the wall of my bed....and of course, it's cold.

*Sigh*....it really sucks living this far apart (even though it's not as bad as it could be).  It'll suck even more if we have to live even farther apart.  Someday, I wish I could come home from work and find him here.  That would kick ass!

June 30th, Mat Wixson in Champaigne.  People should go!

I really don't understand the point of this entry, but it made me feel better!

So, I was reading Adam's ex-girlfriend's blog on her myspace and read something that was oh so very true.  It was titled "for the boys".  And this the the content:

Things for you to know about your girlfriend:
- If a guy is bothering her, it is your right to beat the shit out of him.
- Beware of every single male relative and all guy friends. Any of them would kick your ass at the drop of a hat, and a lot of them wouldn't even wait for the damn hat.
- Don't be afraid to touch them if you want to. If they're going out with you in the first place, it's because they like being in your arms.
- Not all of them eat like birds, a lot of them can eat like whales.
- Don't be freaked out by PMS. It's not gross, and it really does make them feel like shit, so be understanding.
- Don't stress where you go for every date. They really only WANT TO BE WITH YOU!!
- After you've been dating for a while, realize that they really have started to trust you. When you have a girlfriend who truly trusts you, you have a lot more responsibility, privilege and control than you would think. Be careful with it, most guys would kill for that kind of power, and it can be lost in a nanosecond.

More things about girls:
- midol is like crack. end of story.
- we will never be too old for sleepovers.
- gossip isnt a sin. its an art.
- we arent ashamed to cry.
- we must go to the bathroom in groups
- we have this thing called feelings. dont hurt them.
- we dont wake up looking pretty. it takes time and effort
- sometimes is just never quite enough.
- we need girls nights OFTEN.
- we hold grudges and we never forget the things you say to us that hurt.
- it doesnt matter who dumped who or why. whenever we see an ex with another girl, it always bothers us. not because were not over you, but because we know we used to be that girl.
- makeup can hide so many things, like puffy eyes from crying to huge scars from a broken heart
- never ever ask a girl what she weighs; or simply anything about her weight being too much or too little. just don`t do it.
- never ask a girl if shes being so bitchy cause of PMS...cause other things do annoy us...duh
- as much as we say we didnt like u that much...we did
- girls notice every little thing so be careful what you say and do
- our eyes are located in our heads. not our chest or butt. when you're not looking in our eyes, WE KN0W.
- we get a feeling in our gut when things are wrong- sometimes we trust you because we want to even when we know you are lying, and it hurts
 The end

Small update...

I got accepted into Western Illinois University (WIU).  Pretty excited about it.  I'll be going to school with Annette, Cooge, and Maddy.  Hopefully one of them needs a roommate!

Goals are getting completed rather quickly.  Goal 1 got done today.  I looks pretty neat.  I like it alot!  Goals 2,5, and 7 are getting done alot this month and next.  Dylan is coming to see me tomorrow!  And goal 9 will be completed soon.  My uncle is getting me a really good deal on Canon so hopefully I'll get that this month.

Zach is in town for the next month.  I'm pretty sure that I'll be over at the house plenty this month.  

Damn....it's a busy month.  Also, I'm trying to make my room more comfortable.....or just more like my dorm.  More of my draws are going up, Christmas lights are strung up and most of my college crap is being moved into John's old bedroom.  Basically, my room is my sanctuary again.....

I'm done today.  Hope I can sleep tonight.

Summer, summer, summer....and a hot one at that.

So the goals are getting somewhat done.  Some of them might not happen this summer....like the painting and the "Divine Comedy".  The reason is because I'm working on others harder.

Zach will be here in a few days, which I'm pretty excited about!  I'll have someone to hang out with.  It hasn't been hard, but people's schedules are all kinds of everywhere.  And since I have to get up early, I don't want to stay out to late...considering how busy we are.

I've been really emotional lately......I think it's just PMS.

Tomorrow, I hope to go out to the lake.  Mat has a boat and guess a bunch of us (Michelle, Lynde, Bermy) will be going out there.  Woo hoo.

I need to call Jane and Alexis!  I must hang out with them!
      

Anyways, I'm out

A short update.....

Adam graduated today.  Something to be excited about.  The past 2 days I worked my ass off to help with this party.  I'm really tired so I'm making this update short.  Unfortunately, Dylan wasn't able to come up for it due to gas prices and Family Video screwing him over.  However, it was a good time.

So far, Goals 2, 4, 5 have been going alright.....ok...I lied about 4....but I'm working on it and it's hard work.  Michelle got a job which means she'll be busy too.  However, I got to see her today too.  So, things will be getting better I'm sure.  Goal 7 will happen later on in the summer....same with 1, but I'm getting tired of my hair right now.  I'm up for a change.  The others are being worked on.

I still haven't heard from Northern yet, but I should by the end of this month.  I'll keep people posted if they care any.

Also, I absolutely adore my boyfriend!  He got me the new Suburban Legends CD!  I'm excited!  Love you Dyl!

Anyways...short....but whatever

I forgot one!!

Goal 10- Learn more and become more in touch with my religion
I think after my mom read "The Da Vinci Code", she got a little better understanding of Wicca.  So, now, I want to buy more books and supplies so I can actually feel comfortable in performing rituals, estabats, and spells.  I have done some rituals before, but I'm afraid that I'm doing something wrong.  Thus, wanting to learn more.  Anyone have suggestions of good authors?

I've been thinking about the summer so far and realized that I'm pretty unhappy.  I got depressed last night because I started thinking about what I'm going to do this summer.  I have nothing really to look forward too.  Maybe a few shows here or there....but that's it.  I decided to make a list of goals for this summer.  Just some things that I plan on completing.  These are them (in no particular order):

Goal 1- Dye my hair
I want to go back to something wild and bold.  I don't want to go purple again, or any other odd color for that matter.  It was a hassle to keep dying it over and over again.  I don't know......any suggestions would be great.  I think I'll have Michelle go with me to pick something.  Maybe go copper?  Speaking of Michelle....comes my next goal.....

Goal 2- Rekindle old friendships
Last summer, I bailed out on plans with my friends alot.......It was my fault and I'm sorry about it.  I always have been.  This summer, I want to be with my friends as often as possible.  I work full-time, which kind of brings down afternoon plans....but evenings are always open....and weekends!  I want to call Leah and hang out with her.  She lives and town and we always had fun.  I want to hang out with Jane and Alexis.  I'll be living close to Alexis in the fall, so I want to keep a good friendship going.  I want to hang out with Maddy and actually hang out!  And, mostly, hang out with Michelle and all of our friends from high school.  She always told me about parties and other get-togethers that she and others had last summer.  I want to be a part of that so badly!  People....GIVE ME YOUR PHONE NUMBERS!!

Goal 3- Start and FINISH a painting
I blame my drawing class for getting me hooked again.  I just don't know what to paint.  HELP!

Goal 4- Lose weight
I gained about 10 pounds in the last 2 months.  It might not seem drastic, but to me it is.  To go to the doctor and go from 132 to 142 is a HUGE jump.  I don't like seeing my ass get bigger and my stomach begin to bulge!  I'm cutting out sweets (ice cream, candy, etc.) and fast food (minus Subway and Head West).  Plus, that tread mill will be put to good use.

Goal 5- See Dylan without over doing the driving
In the past week, he has come to see me twice.  That is a shit load of driving when it takes and hour and a half to get here...and another to get back.  Since gas has gone up, I'm not sure how much we can do this.  However, I'm going to see him as much as I can.  Living 5 hours away is going to be hard on both of us, but it can be done!  And we are willing to do so!!

Goal 6- Finish "The Divine Comedy"
What did I get myself into!  It's a really good book, but hard to understand.  I will complete it though!

Goal 7- See as many shows as possible
Need I say more!

Goal 8- Visit Jason in Chicago
This needs to be done.  I haven't seen him in a year and it's becoming torture.  I miss him so much and I want to have the chance to see him before he leaves for U of I.

Goal 9- Save up money to buy a digital camera
I wanted either and iPod or camera for Christmas.  I got my iPod which I love, but now I want a digital camera.  They are so much more convenient and, in the end, alot cheaper than buying film and batteries and then paying for developing.  I'm not looking for something flashy, big, and expensive.....something cheap and good quality.

I really can't think of anything more.  It's just good to see a list of things I can look forward too.....

What is your perspective of me? Using a candybar doll maker, make a doll of me from what you remember of my looks and post it here in the comments. Once you've posted here, ask the same in your own journal and see what your friends think you look like!

This is a short update for the past week or two.

SLU is out of the picture.  My financial aid came through.  However, it was far from enough.  With work study, I would have gotten $15,500 in grants, loans, and work study program.  Without it, it would have been $12,900.  This leave me and my parents with about $27,000 to make up for.  We just don't have that kind of money floating around somewhere.  So, I won't be going.....

However, I sent all my information to Northern University in Dekalb, which is about an hour outside of Chicago.  The downside to this is that I'll be about, 3-5 hours away from my family, friends, and Dylan.  The upside, this university would be a better college for my anyways....and cheaper.  My dad talked to the head of the National Weather Service in Illinois.  He was taking a forecasting class that this guy was teaching.  Anyways, after the class, my dad told him about my conundrum and asked which college would be better, SLU or Northern?  The guy laughed and said that Northern would be a better choice.  The reason:  SLU offers more in the research aspect of Meteorology.  They know mathematics and the dynamics of a storm, however, they can't forecast worth shit.  Yet, Northern is more about forecasting and storm chasing.  My dad told me this and it was like a weight lifted off my shoulders.  I was so happy to know this.  So, my dad sent me his info and I emailed him thanking him for his input.  And I guess that now this guy wants me to come to the offices in Lincoln to check out the place and maybe sign up for an internship!  The news just gets better!

Anyways, that makes me happy....but, now, I have to have another long distance relationship.  But, we talked and he's more than willing to make things work!  He might even go to Columbia in Chicago sometime in the near future!  Yay, film schools!

Crisis dealt with.

Tomorrow, I leave for Ska Weekend!  I'll be back on Sunday...which leaves me time to study for my final on Tuesday.  However, I still have a project to get done for my art class.  Stupidest thing ever....

Well,.....I'll be back Sunday!

Saw Reel Big Fish last night!! It was for free at UMSL(?). It was pretty bad ass! They played outside in a parking lot that was HUGE and held enough people there. Anyways, I can't hear out of my left ear. But it was worth it!!

IT'S MY BIRTHDAY!!!

that's all I have to say  :P

I felt like updating.  I'm currently procrastinating from an art project.

So, from my last update.  Person with the shitty boyfriend is still staying with him.  Don't ask me why.....she just is......

Obviously, I got accepted into SLU.  I'm pretty excited about this.  It's going to be hard, but right now we're just trying to figure out how we are going to pay for all this.  For a year at SLU with most thing included, it's about $35,000.  It's way to much for us.  I hope financial aid comes through on this for me.  I might be in debt the rest of my life!

Anyways, on a lighter note....my birthday is in 6 days!  This weekend I'll be heading home to celebrate Easter and my birthday.  Plus, I'll be taking Dylan with me!  It shall be interesting....I can see it now....Adam and Dylan playing games till 4 in the morning!  Sweet.....

Then, on Monday (which is the 17th...my real birthday), Dylan is throwing me a party at his town house.  Anyone is welcome if they feel like driving to Collinsville for the night!

Then a weekend later.....SKA WEEKEND!!!!  Need I say more.  By the way...who decided to throw the Tosser on the list?  I figured out the reason why....I just don't understand.  Oh well....

I GOT ACCEPTED INTO SLU!!!!!!!!!!!!  HELL YES!!!!!

I'm in the Meteorology program now!

*happy dance*
P.S.~  Mat Wixson rocks house!!!  Saw him Saturday and he is the shit.  Thanks Mat for coming to play!!!

I've gotten to the point where i officially hate it here.  I'm still wondering how I'm making it through this year.  It seems like college is getting to that point of not being enjoyable anymore.  It is now school, and that's it for me.  Everything outside of school is what I consider "college". SIUE can lick my ass.....

Why you wonder?  Well, as I was sitting in my room, staring out the window on this beautiful day and getting ready to type up my theater paper, I got to wondering...."Why the hell am I in a theater class?  What does theater have to do with Meteorology?  And why am I in that stupid fucking history class?  How are any of these relevant to my major?"  After thinking about this I got pissed off at myself for choosing those classes.  I got pissed at the administrators for not doing their jobs.  After the angry comments and thoughts......I now hate this place.  I don't enjoy it anymore.

The crappy thing?  I have to keep up my grades no matter what.  I have to suffer through these dumb classes in order to keep up my grades to transfer.  And to generally stay in school.  My parents will pull me out of college if my GPA isn't at or above a 3.0.  The only reason of me not breaking my point of insanity is either my classes being canceled, or I skip.  And I hate it when I don't go to class.  I feel like I'm worthless.....but I can't stand my classes.

I think I need someone to smack me in the face and give me some uplifting words....
I officially own Keasbey Nights as performed by Streetlight Manifesto!!! Holy shit!! It is AMAZING!!! I can't stop listening to it! FUCK YES!!

Semester is going way to slow for my liking.  I really wish that summer would come.  Or maybe just get Ska Weekend here ASAP.  

Speaking of Ska Weekend....BIG D AND THE KIDS TABLE!!!!  I can't wait now!  At first I was a little worried about the past line up, but now that they and The Flatliners are on main stage....my life is complete!

Next year I'll hopefully be transferring out of SIUE.  The possibly is SLU, but I went ahead and sent in the application to Oklahoma anyways.  I'm curious if I'll get accepted or not.  With the research I did, I'll most likely get in.  However, I found out that with both schools, I'll have to send in my transcripts from SIUE.  The bogus thing?.....it cost money to send them to the colleges!!  It's a piece of paper with grades.  Fucking bullshit.......  I know that there's reasons for the costs and what not, but still....ridiculous...

Valentine's Day went well this year!  I've always had an extreme hate for this day.  But it seems like everyone else doesn't like it either.  However, I don't like it because I think it's a silly day.....most others don't like it because they're bitter.  Anyways, I got my titty bear!!!  I was quite excited to get him.  Plus, he's massive and fun to cuddle with! <3  I also got flowers and a card!  The big upside...it was nice outside so we went to a park.....downside....it got fucking windy and cold by the time we got to play around.  However, we still had a fun time!  Made me forget that Kong day was yesterday.  Whoops...........
But I was introduced to more Mystery Science Theater 3000 shows that had Joel as the host!  Fucking right!  WATCH OUT FOR SNAKES!!!

ugh.....waiting for a call from Dylan....then to his place!

Internet ordering is the most convenient system known to man.  John got me a Bets Buy gift card for Christmas and I just spent it on a CD and DVD.  Right on....

I'm kind of disappointed by the Ska Weekend line up.  At first glance and seeing Catch 22, I was kind of excited......Until I remembered their live DVD and how much it sucked.  Then I gave some of the other bands a listen too.  The Know How sound pretty good......but I Voted For Kodos doesn't really trip my trigger.  Dylan was telling how he saw them last year and said something about their music going down hill.  I gave it a listen and wasn't impressed.  However, now the Pietasters are on.  At least there's some hope.....  If MU330 and Big D could get on, my life would be complete!

Classes are going pretty well.  I wasn't able to drop my art class.  I sucked it up and I'm getting my work done.  The professor is pretty impressed.  We'll see how the rest of the semester goes.  I have high hopes.  Plus, a class with Dyl, Justin, and Lana "Art is not free!!" Hagan......doesn't get much better!

I've been listening the hell out of old RCR, Suburban Legends, Bomb the Music Industry, and Arrogant Sons of a Bitches.  I'm addicted.

Anyone heard of Ska Circus?  It's in Las Vegas and seems pretty damn expensive.  However, the line up is pretty fucking awesome.  But the money issue blows ass.  Oh well.....

I think I'm done......fuck off.  <3

Son of a bitch!  It's a new year!

Semester so far is good.  Schedule is as follows:

Monday Wednesday Friday

Art 112a Drawing
World Regions

Tuesday Thursday

History of Religions in Europe
The Dramatic Experience
Physical Geography

There you have it....Not as exciting, but I do have a the dramatic experience with Dyl and Justin!  Interesting so far...

New Years Eve non-party was sooooo much fun!  I'm very glad that I went.  Also, I met an entire crowd of bad asses!!

Anyways....I really have nothing to say.....Just felt like writing.

Date with Dylan on Friday!  <3

Updates seem to be rare for me these days.  Live journal seems to blow more and more every time I happen upon it's existence.

An uneventful Christmas break so far.  My entire schedule is full of mad scientist work.  However, the majority of it is sitting at the desks and staring at a blank computer screen for a good half hour to only have Ryan throw a backlog in front of me and say, "Run this sample for me."  Usually I'd be excited, but it takes me 10 minutes to calibrate the instrument and another 5 to run the sample (depending on the tests that need to be run).  Afterward, I go back to my little spot at the desk and go back to staring at that computer screen.  Thank you EPA for sending us diddly squat.  

The rest of break should be interesting....

Speaking of interesting.....Dylan came to visit me on Tuesday!  Adventures in Springfield really are not as fun as Collinsville and the surrounding cities.  However, we managed to have ourselves fucking bad ass time, minus the Plunket show that really wasn't as good as I hoped.  And as Dylan nicely put it..."They can keep my 5 dollars.  I just want my life back."  Anyways, the adventures ensue for New Years Eve when the "Dylanglea Fest 2005 1/2" party takes place back in Collinsville.  A large non-alcoholic party with plenty sugar to clog the arteries!  And don't forget the craptacular movie line up that will take place all night!  FUCK YES!

I miss him already!

Anyways.....other than work and a boyfriend.....that seems to be the extent of my break.

Merry fucking Christmas!  Hallelujah!...holy shit!

Stolen......

If you read this, if your eyes are passing over this right now, even if we don't speak often, please post a comment with a memory of you and me. It can be anything you want, either good or bad.

When you're finished, post this little paragraph on your blog and be surprised (or mortified) about what people remember about you.

Finally got new cell phones over break.  Maybe now when people call me at home, I won't have to ask them to repeat themselves every minute.  Plus, it works better down here at school.  About god damn time....

I'm working through another art block again.  My current ceramics class has kept me busy, but the long nights of having a fresh pad of paper in front of you with nothing to draw kind of gets on my nerves.  I've been working on the a sketch of Chuq from a picture that I took awhile back.  The sketch is good on paper, but I'd really like to get it on canvas.  My hopes are to paint it and have it look relatively nice.  However, knowing my painting capabilities worries me.  We'll see what happens with it.  I really want it to look nice.

Seems like my fish has survived the trials of starving for about 10 days.  I left him here over break with the hopes of his surviving through the week.  He made it!  What a trooper..

Speaking of ceramics, I was able to get a certain person's gift done for their birthday.  I hope said person likes it.

Damn Christmas.......I loathe shopping for the holidays.  While some have fun, I cannot see the joy in running from store to store, bumping elbows with everyone around you to the that "hot item" on the list, and then proceed to wait in line for hours on end just to move to the next store and do it all over again.  Forget it.  Internet shopping, here I come.  I'd rather enjoy my shopping experience for others.

Speaking of pains......finals.  Need I say more.  

However, I must stay above a 3.0 in order for me to go to Nepal next year.  Seems as though plans are moving smoothly.  All I have to do is get into a Climatology class for next semester and I should be set.  Now comes forms and scholarships......But I'm ready to go!  Earthquakes, cold, and Himalayas HERE I COME!!!!!

Oh life.  You taunt me so!

www.scarlet-moon.deviantart.com

Check it out and tell me what you think!

Some days, I thank god for choosing to be a Meteorologists.  Hearing about people suffering in Organic Chem. is sad.
My meteorology professor was telling us a story today of how he made a margarita out of hail stones.  I laughed for the longest time.  

I'm having problems with a costume idea.  If anyone has suggestions that are not the cliche types (vampires, witches, pirate, devil, cat, etc.), then I'm up for any.

I love all my friends that helped me through my crappy week!  You guys make life better!

Hope to be dying my hair soon.  Maybe Kathrine can help me?  I need someone that can do streaks for me.  With bleach and foil......

Homework is my master....

...I miss my baby.....and I feel like shit because I was in a cranky mood yesterday and was kind of mean to him.

If you see this Chuck, I apologize again. :.(

I love you!

I love Chuck.  I talked to him last night about a friend of his that is trying to become more trendy in his fashion sense.  Chuck told me that you don't need to do things just to make others happy or to impress them.  Just to be yourself.

So, I say, screw the new fashions.  Screw the people that think that's how I'm supposed to look.  I'm happy with myself!  And that's all that matters!

Just got home from a really nice weekend.  My cousin Erin got married and I was a bride's maid.  It turned out very nicely!

I've been watching TLC's What Not to Wear.  I'm starting to feel more self-conscious because I see myself in alot of the girls that are on this show.  Michelle has told me before that she would love to put me on this show.  It would be great to find some clothes that are nice yet fit my style.  I guess I'm open for anything.  Does anyone have good fashion sense and $5,000 for me?

I wish I could get Adam and Chuck here for a weekend this month instead of next month.  Can anyone pretend to be Chuck for a weekend so I can get him down here before it gets cold out?  I'm pretty sure Adam is open to any weekend.  He's easy going.

Papers, projects, tests, quizzes.  Tis my life.
This one is for Chuck!!!

Close your eyes... And go back...

Before the Internet or the AIM

Before semi automatics and weed

Before playstation2 or X-bOX

Before the 5 hours of homework you put off every night...


Way back...


I'm talkin' bout hide and go seek at dusk.

Red light, Green light.

Playing kickball & dodgeball until your porch light came on.

Mother May I?

Red Rover

four square

Hula Hoops

Running through the sprinkler

Happy Meals

Getting the privilege to sit in the front seat of the car



Wait...

Watchin' Saturday Morning cartoons

Like Hey Arnold and Doug

Or what about legends of the hidden temple, global guts, double dare, and who, ARE YOU AFRAID OF THE DARK!

Who could forget Snick

Or the teenage mutant ninja turtles,and Power Rangers,


Christmas morning...

Your first day of school

Bedtime Prayers and Goodnight Kisses



Climbing trees

Getting an ice cream off the ice cream truck

A million mosquito bites and sticky fingers

Jumpin' down the steps

Jumpin' on the bed

Pillow fights

Runnin' till you were out of breath

Laughing so hard that your stomach hurt and you almost peed your pants

Being tired from playin' all day

Your first crush...

Rainy days at school meant playing "Heads up 7-Up" in the classroom

Remember that?



I'm not finished yet...

Kool-Aid was the drink of the summer

Giving your friends a ride on your handlebars or spokes

Wearing your new shoes on the first day of school

Class Field Trips

When nearly everyone's mom was at home when the kids got there.

When getting high was swinging on the swingset

When $5 seemed like a million, and another dollar a Miracle.

When your parents took you to McDonalds and you were so cool.

When Toys r Us overruled the "mall"


I want to go back to the time when...

Decisions were made by going "eeny-meeny-miney-moe"

Mistakes were corrected by simply exclaiming, "do over!"

"Race issue" meant arguing about who ran the fastest.

Money issues were handled by whoever was the banker in "monopoly"

Catching fireflies could happily occupy an entire evening

It wasn't odd to have two or three "best" friends.

Being old, referred to anyone over 20.

The worst thing you could catch from the opposite sex was cooties.

Nobody was prettier than Mom

Nobody was cooler than Dad

Scrapes and bruises were kissed and made better

It was a big deal to finally be tall enough to ride the "big people" rides at the amusement park.

Getting an inch of snow was a dream come true.

Abilities were discovered because of a "double-dog-dare"

Spinning around, getting dizzy and falling down was cause for giggles.


If you can remember most or all of these, then you have LIVED!!!

I know that I don't usually update about weekends, but this one was update worthy.

Friday mainly consisted of driving.  My classes blew, due to the fact that I was late to all of them.  However, I was still in a good mood.  I went out to dinner with my dad and talked about the past 2 weeks.  It was nice to actually get to catch up with my dad instead of always my mom.  Anyways, I went and saw my baby and had an interesting night with dying hair.

Saturday was my grandma's birthday.  We went out to a friend-of-the-family's camping ground and had an awesome lunch.  I caught quite a few fish too!  Good times.......Then, the benefit show!  Holy shit!  What an amazing show!  Most of the bands that I heard did pretty well.  I kind of wish I would have been there for Solemn Vow.  Bastognes Best tore it up with the addition of my little brother as Exact Change Man!  It seemed by that time, all the ska scene kids wanted to bust out some moves.  And they did!!  Chuq was amazing at commanding the crowd!  He was a true rock star that night!  <3 :P  At a point in the night, they had a true western gun duel.  Some guy killed Exact Change Man, but was badass when he did it!  He did one of those James Bond roll moves and killed the poor bastard.  All in all, it was a great night!  Bravo to all the bands and all the kids that came to support local bands and the new cafe.

Sunday mostly consisted of shopping and packing up to leave.  I didn't get to see my boy because of another show, but I'll get to see him again some other time.

It was great to actually hang out with Adam on Saturday.  I'm glad him and I have a good relationship.  Better than wanting to kill him all the time!

<3 to everyone.  Classes tomorrow, sleep tonight.

A scanner, a scanner, my kingdom for a scanner!

I have quiet a few new drawings that I have spit out on paper.  However, I lack the scanner to get them on my deviant art page.  People have been demanding!  How much are those things anyways?

My sketch book looks kind of mixed up.  I'll usually start on a picture and think of something better.  Or, I end up getting frustrated with the one I am on.  Instead of erasing it, I just start a new one.  Point is, I have alot of unfinished drawings that I should try to fix and finish.

I realized that there are way to many emo/goth kids here at school.  Obviously those fresh out of high school haven't gotten past that stage of growing up.  It seems kind of harsh to say that, but come on people!  You're 18/19 and an adult now!  Get out of those bondage pants and face paints!  To many people are laughing at you because you're stuck being 16!  This is college, not the mall!........Venting......and I'm pretty sure I'm going to get comments back saying that people are just trying to be individuals and express themselves.  However, it's not individuality when they all look like clones.

On that note, I'm going to go.     <3 rude boy!

Every chick says they want a nice guy, but I am under the impression they dont because, for some reason, nice guys always get dumped for bad boys and/or horny fuck-tards. Why are some dudes such assholes?


-To every guy that says I love you.
-To every guy that opens doors.
-To every guy that walks on the outside of a sidewalk so he can be the first to get hit by a car that careens off the road and push her out of the way.
-To every guy that cooks dinner for her.
-To every guy that said, "Sex can wait."
-To every guy that said, "You're beautiful."
-To every guy that was never too busy to drive across town to see her.
-To every guy that gives flowers and a card when she is sick (And even a stuffed animal perhaps).
-To every guy who has given her flowers just because she is feeling a bit depressed.
-To every guy that said he would die for her.
-To every guy that really would.
-To every guy that did what she wanted to do.
-To every guy that treated her like a princess.
-To every guy that cried in front of her.
-To every guy that she cried in front of.
-To every guy that holds hands with her.
-To every guy that kisses her with meaning.
-To every guy that hugs her when shes sad.
-To every guy who would give their jacket up.
-To every guy that calls to make sure she got home safe.
-To every guy that would sit and wait for her for hours just to be able to see her for ten minutes.
-To every guy that would give his seat up.
-To every guy that just wants to cuddle.
-To every guy that will just sleep (no sex) with her.
-To every guy that reassured her that she was beautiful no matter what (even if she got fat).
-To every guy who told his secrets to her.
-To every guy that tried to show how much he cared through every word and every breathe.
-To every guy that thought maybe this could be the one.
-To every guy that believed in her dreams.
-To every guy that would have done anything so she could achieve them.
-To every guy that never laughed at her when she told him her dreams.
-To every guy that wasn't just trying to get laid.
-To every guy that actually listened.

---*To every guy that gave his heart only to have it shoved back in his face.

This one is for you.

I survived my first week of school.  Things will be good for the semester.  I'm just ready to get back home for a little R&R.

Because of this big ass hurricane that is going through the south, I have a big ass assignment for my Meteorology class that really rocks!  I have to watch the rain clouds that are currently coming in from the east and watch for rotations, currents, temperature, and cloud formation.  Also, I have to watch the news channels and look on the internet frequently to look at sea surge, barometric pressure, and wind speeds to determine what class/category hurricane that it is at this moment.  And by tomorrow, we have to have a prediction of the path of the hurricane through the states.  We're supposed to keep somewhat of a log of all of this.  We'll see how it goes.  But from what I see, those rain clouds won't be here until late tonight.  Fun!

I don' have a lot more to talk about.  Bastognes Best will have a show sometime this weekend!  Keep your eyes peeled for updates.  Support your local ska band!

I miss my rude boy.  <3 you Chuqqlz!

I bought a Boondock Saints poster!!

I'm back in college.  It seems strange to finally be back.  Even though I spent 9 months of my life here last year, it's still taking some time to get used to things again.

Our room is really nice.  The furniture is rearranged a different way and it looks alot nicer.  We are currently waiting for my mom to send us our Christmas lights to put around the room.  Also, we live in a quieter end of the hall.  Sort of away from the constant noise of where we were last year.

I was able to find all my classes today and I'm  pretty excited to see how things turn out with that.  Hopefully well.

So far I've made quite a few new friends here in the dorms.  Some are girls, but guys are the ones that are more social.  

With that, I must state my extreme dislike for so many people saying.."Oh, the guys are only being nice because they are hitting on you."....Now, I'm not trying to sound naive and I know that some guys do just want a piece of ass, but honestly, can't a girl JUST be friends with a guy with no feelings involved?  I have a shit load more guy friends then girl friends and I'm know that not one of them sees me more than a friend.  I'm sick of hearing about it.  

I had to rant for a second....I feel better.  Anyways, I'm off.  I hope all the boys are having fun at Powerlight!  I miss you, Chuq!!!  I miss my boys!!  I miss the band!!

I just got back from seeing Four Brothers, which opened today. Amazing. Lets put it this way....take The Boondock Saints and Tombstone, mix those two movies together and set it in Detroit and you got this movie. It's perfect for those who love vigil-anti killer movies. Great great great! School shopping in the morning. Looks like I'm going to be busy most of the day. Hopefully I'll get to the fair tomorrow. If not, I can always pick a different day. We'll see.... Wednesday is my last day at work. Damn the EPA for not sending us our samples. Looks like I'm working during Christmas break. A few extra dollars in the pocket will be nice. Leaving to school in a week. Back to my home away from home. I'll miss some people here. Such as: Adam, John, the band, and of course Chuck. However, I'll be glad to leave behind alot of people who I don't care to see anymore. I can't wait to move back in with Michelle. Maybe spending time away from each other during the summer was a good thing. We'll see..... I talked to a co-worker of mine that told me that they quit drinking because it got boring and they see how stupid it is to even start. That it's only temporary and it gets old. I told him that's why I will never start. Shepherds we shall be For Thee, my Lord, for Thee Power hath descended forth from Thy hands So feet may swiftly car out Thy commands And we shall flow a river forth to Thee And teaming with souls shall it ever be Et Nomini Parti, Et Fili, Spiritus Santi

But if you're going to be a chicken shit coward and not come forward and say shit to my face and accept consequences, then fuck off and don't bother posting on here.  Be that coward that you are and put things on my live journal just so you can pretend to say "I made a point".

So, whoever was Mr. Anonymous that posted on my last entry won't have that option of posting anymore.  I really don't care what people say about me because I get shit like that all the time.  But when it doesn't include a name or face, then find somewhere else to bitch about me.  I honestly don't care.

Live that pathetic life of your's behind the safety of others not knowing who you are.....child.

Why am I so scared of anesthesia?  I hate the idea of being put to sleep without your own will.....

I'm really scared.............I really need a hug.......

I want Chuck right now  :.(

I love love love love Interview with the Vampire!!! I need to find someone who is will to sit and watch some good and really shitty vampire movies with me. Someone other than Michelle... :P I'm officially certified to run 5 different tests at work. They are: Total Suspended Solids(TSS), Ammonia, pH, Percent Moisture(Pmoist), and Alkalinity. I know that it probably means nothing to some, but for me, it's a pretty big deal. It means that if I every pursue anything in the chemistry field, I'm certified to run these tests without training. I'm pretty proud of myself to in getting this far. Seems like I'll be home more often then I expected..... So if you guys missed the first Bastognes Best show, there's going to be another one very very soon! Keep your eyes open for updates on the who, when, and where. 24 days left!

Bastognes Best was amazing last night.  I never knew that a band could set up like that and still draw a nice size crowd.  It's nice to see the many people who still support local music.  Even my mom said that she would have gone if she wasn't in Chicago at the time.  I love how she supports the arts.....including music.

I officially want to learn how to play an instrument(s).  I used to do piano.....but that was when I was in 5th grade.  I quit because my grades weren't doing well, and my parents thought it was me practicing piano to much.  They screwed me over on that one.  However, after seeing these guys do so well last night, I really want to learn how.  I just need to find someone who will have the time and patience to sit down and teach me.  This will be hard......

Why do people still throw the word "love" around so often?  I know about 3 people that are in new relationships.  It has been a week and they are already saying that they love the person they are with.  But is it really love?  Or is it just happiness?  Or is it finally getting the attention from a female/male that one has been striving for for to long?  Kids these days......

I'm also developing an extreme hate for whining.  People do and and they do it way to often.  Mostly about how their life sucks.  Go cry about it somewhere else emo kids.  Or find a way to fix it.  Fuck...

28 more days until I move back to school....  :D

Jane or Alexis.....I need art ideas!!

Life continues......not really much to say lately.  Things have been going well.  I haven't seen much of either of my brothers this summer.  I understand the reason with John.  However, it seems like I never get to see Adam much anymore.  Usually I get home from work and he's not home or he is and I have plans to go out somewhere.  But it's the same on the weekends too.  He's always upstairs playing those silly video games.....or he's in the basement on the computer.  If not that, he's out with friends.  Honestly.....I wish there was more that I could do to get him away from these stupid machines.  Seems like his life is run by games..........

My job is fantastic.  JP has offered for me to come back during breaks to work for him......or, basically, whenever he needs me.  He said that he's "very proud of how far I have come" and that I'm "a dedicated and hard worker."  Seems like everyone is proud of me!

I hate it how some people really don't care what happens to them.  Just as long as they get that something that makes them happy, they don't care.  I know of some guys that need to wake up or they will be in jail.

I love to be loved by someone I love and who loves me back!  Eat your heart out River City Rebels!

 (\ /)
 (0.v)   <----cuddle bunny!!  It's winking!
 (> <)

Alright....like I said.....not alot to update about.  OH!  July 22nd will have a show!  Bastognes Best will be playing!  Keep looking for updates.  Rock on, boys.

Hell yes kids!  I got my internship!!!!  Looks like I start Thursday.  I'll be working from 8 in the morning until about 4 in the afternoon.  I get a lab coat and everything!  It's a small thing to be excited about, but it's kind of cool once you think about it.

Anyways, I'm excited and I can't wait to start!  I'M A MAD SCIENTIST!!!!

Chicago was awesome!  I had a fantastic time there.  I never realized how much I love that city.  Even if traffic is a minor set back.

We ended up leaving home around 10 am.  We got to the hotel around 1:30.  The traffic was really backed up due to all the events that were going on.  We checked in and my mom and I meet up with my Aunt Anne there and headed down to the Taste of Chicago.  The food was wonderful and the weather wasn't hot at all.  After eating we ended up in Millennium Park and watched the Crown Park towers change pictures and shoot water from it.  It's hard to explain, but I recommend going.

We went to the park's grill and sat to have a drink for about 2 hours just watching the city.  After that we went to the Metro and watched the bands compete in Emergenza.  It was wild!  Maxlider did a really good job!  However, there were alot of other REALLY good bands that were there.  The great thing was, not all the bands were the same genre which was a bit of a relief.  I was afraid that I would be sitting through all hard rock bands.  But, there were punk, rock, hard rock, emo, new age rock, indy......etc.

But, in the end, the indy band got first, which wasn't a really big surprise because they were very very good.  Maxlider got 4th......however, they got the award for best visual and audio performance!  All in all, they were great!

So, basically, today, I woke up, ate breakfast, talked to Erik about going to see Velvet Revolver at the State Fair(which I think is a go), said our goodbyes, then came home.

Fun, sore.....all that jazz......

Finally found a way of occupying my time with a job.  Sonic is my current location.  I've been working there for almost a month now.  Seems like things will be ok for the summer.

I really miss Leah Jenner.  Talking on the internet just isn't the same.  I miss her laugh, because it's the kind that can make you laugh harder because it's so cute!  

I miss Christina also.  Unfortunately, I can't do much about it.  She's moving down to Georgia.  Dammit......

I miss Michelle too.  Seems kind of weird when I was able to see my best friend so often last summer.  It's almost the end of June and I've only seen her 3 times this summer.  It really does upset....

Streetlight Manifesto show was very very awesome.  Good times had by all.  Minus the ride back through a monsoon.

I heard someone say something today and it really made me laugh:
"A friend is someone who will bail you out of jail.  A best friend is the person sitting next to you saying, "That was awesome!"

So true.
